choices.C: The detailed designs (future process, systems, operating and organization models) will be based on the existing high-level designs.
choices.B: New up-to-date software will be obtained to produce the graphical sections of the Project and Stage Plans.
choices.A: The Project Manager will involve the selected service provider in the creation of the Stage Plan for stage 4.

questions.question_text:
While deciding on how the work of the project should be approached the following were considered.
Which statement is appropriate for inclusion in the project approach heading in the Project Brief?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This statement is appropriate for inclusion in the project approach heading in the Project Brief. It describes an important aspect of how the project work will be approached, specifically, that detailed designs will be based on existing high-level designs. This provides clarity on the approach to design work in the project and helps set expectations for project stakeholders.

choices.A: MFH has no experience in outsourcing and this may affect understanding of what is required, resulting in inadequate plans and strategies.
choices.B: The Project Brief is a complex document and may not be approved by the Executive.
choices.C: There is a shortage of service providers so there is a possibility that no suitable service providers respond to the request for proposals. This would prevent the Outsourcing project from proceeding.

questions.question_text:
While planning the initiation stage, the Project Manager reviewed some threats that had been recorded in the Daily Log.
Which threat should have been assessed for possible risk responses to be included in the Initiation Stage Plan?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This threat is appropriate for assessment and inclusion in the risk responses within the Initiation Stage Plan. It represents a significant risk that could impact the project's ability to proceed with outsourcing if no suitable service providers respond. Therefore, it's important to assess this threat and plan appropriate risk responses, such as identifying alternative actions or contingency plans in case this risk materializes.

questions.question_text: While preparing the Risk Management Strategy, the Project Manager considered the commercial customer/supplier environment and how this may affect the management of risk. Which approach should the Outsourcing project adopt?

choices.B: All project risks associated with the specialist deliverables should be owned by the selected service provider.
choices.C: Due to the sensitive nature of this project, consideration should be given to creating a separate Risk Register to be held by MFH and the selected supplier.
choices.A: Plan to use the selected service provider's risk management procedures.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Refer 10.3.6 Commercial Consideration 
In a commercial context there may be a need for more than one risk register as some project risks could be unique to only one party, with good reasons for them not to be visible to the other party.

A. Plan to use the selected service provider's risk management procedures.

In an outsourcing project, it is common to leverage the risk management procedures and expertise of the selected service provider. This approach can be beneficial because the service provider often has experience and established processes for managing risks associated with the services they provide.

By planning to use the service provider's risk management procedures, you can tap into their knowledge and resources to identify, assess, and mitigate risks effectively. It also ensures that the risk management efforts are aligned with the specifics of the outsourced services.

Selected Answer: C
Also think it is "C"

questions.question_text:
While preparing the Quality Management Strategy, the Project Manager noticed that the corporate quality management system does not specifically cover project management.
Which option provides an appropriate way for the Project Manager proceed?

choices.B: Proceed with the project without a Quality Management Strategy and adopt the selected service provider's standards in stage 4.
choices.C: Seek relevant organizational standards, then facilitate a workshop to discuss the Quality Management Strategy with Project Assurance.
choices.A: Record the development of a corporate quality management system for project management as a prerequisite of the Project Plan.
Highlight Reports to the Project Manager; Exception Reports to the Project Board when project tolerances are forecast to be exceeded.
choices.B: Highlight Reports to the Project Board; Exception Reports to corporate management when stage tolerances are forecast to be exceeded.
choices.C: Highlight Reports to the Project Board; Exception Reports to the Project Board when stage or project tolerances are forecast to be exceeded.

questions.question_text: Which project controls should be established for the Outsourcing project?
